meta.note: Valuations reflect latest available data as of December 2025. Major tech companies valued at market cap.

openai.name: OpenAI
openai.founders: Sam Altman, Greg Brockman, Ilya Sutskever, Elon Musk, Wojciech Zaremba
openai.description: OpenAI created ChatGPT and GPT-4, the AI systems that sparked the generative AI revolution. As the leader in large language models, they continue advancing AI capabilities while focusing on safety and alignment.
openai.funding: $13B+ total funding. $10B from Microsoft (2023), $6.6B round at $157B valuation (Oct 2024)

anthropic.name: Anthropic
anthropic.valuation_note: Series F Dec 2025, $13B led by ICONIQ
anthropic.founders: Dario Amodei, Daniela Amodei, Tom Brown, Chris Olah, Sam McCandlish, Jared Kaplan
anthropic.description: Anthropic is an AI safety company building Claude, one of the most capable and safest AI assistants. Founded by former OpenAI researchers, they pioneer Constitutional AI and responsible AI development.
anthropic.funding: $8B+ total. $4B from Amazon, $2B from Google. Series E at $18B valuation (2024)

xai.name: xAI
xai.founders: Elon Musk, Igor Babuschkin, Tony Wu, Greg Yang
xai.description: xAI is Elon Musk's AI company building Grok, an AI assistant with real-time access to X (Twitter) data and a witty, unfiltered personality. They aim to build AI that helps humanity understand the universe.

databricks.name: Databricks
databricks.valuation_note: Series L Dec 16, 2025. Doubled from $60B in 12 months
databricks.founders: Ali Ghodsi, Ion Stoica, Matei Zaharia, Andy Konwinski, Reynold Xin, Patrick Wendell, Arsalan Tavakoli-Shiraji
databricks.description: Databricks unifies data engineering, analytics, and AI on one lakehouse platform. Their acquisition of Mosaic ML and DBRX model expanded them into foundation models while serving most Fortune 500 companies.

figure.name: Figure AI
figure.valuation_note: Series C. Ended OpenAI partnership to build own AI.
figure.description: Figure AI is building general-purpose humanoid robots designed to work alongside humans. Their Figure 01 robot combines advanced AI with human-like form to perform tasks in warehouses, manufacturing, and eventually homes.

ssi.name: Safe Superintelligence
ssi.valuation_note: Raised $2B in April 2025. No product yet.
ssi.founders: Ilya Sutskever, Daniel Gross, Daniel Levy
ssi.description: Safe Superintelligence Inc. (SSI) is an AI research company founded by Ilya Sutskever, former OpenAI chief scientist and co-creator of GPT. Focused exclusively on building safe superintelligent AI, they represent one of the most ambitious and well-funded efforts in AI safety research.

anduril.name: Anduril Industries
anduril.founders: Palmer Luckey (Oculus founder), Brian Schimpf, Trae Stephens, Matt Grimm, Joe Chen
anduril.description: Anduril Industries builds advanced defense technology including autonomous systems, sensors, and AI-powered command and control. Their Lattice platform provides military-grade situational awareness.

cursor.name: Cursor (Anysphere)
cursor.valuation_note: Series D Nov 2025. $400M to $29.3B in 18 months
cursor.founders: Michael Truell, Sualeh Asif, Arvid Lunnemark, Aman Sanger
cursor.description: Cursor is an AI-first code editor built on VS Code, featuring deep AI integration for code completion, editing, and chat. It's become the preferred IDE for developers who want AI assistance throughout their workflow, not just autocomplete.

scaleai.name: Scale AI
scaleai.valuation_note: Meta $14.3B for 49%. Warning: private pricing as low as $7.3B
scaleai.description: Scale AI is the data infrastructure company powering the AI revolution. They provide data labeling, synthetic data generation, and model evaluation services to leading AI labs including OpenAI and Meta, making them critical to the development of frontier AI systems.

groq.name: Groq
groq.description: Groq builds custom AI inference chips (LPUs) that deliver the fastest LLM inference in the world. Their hardware enables real-time AI applications with sub-100ms latency for complex language models.

perplexity.name: Perplexity AI
perplexity.founders: Aravind Srinivas, Denis Yarats, Andy Konwinski, Johnny Ho
perplexity.description: Perplexity is the AI-powered answer engine that's reinventing search. Instead of links, it provides direct answers with citations, using real-time web access to deliver accurate, up-to-date information.

celonis.name: Celonis
celonis.founders: Alexander Rinke, Bastian Nominacher, Martin Klenk
celonis.description: Celonis is the global leader in process mining, using AI to analyze business processes and identify inefficiencies. Their execution management platform helps enterprises optimize operations and increase revenue.

nebius.name: Nebius Group
nebius.description: Nebius Group provides AI infrastructure and cloud services, emerging from Yandex's technology division. Their platform serves AI companies with GPU compute and storage at European data centers.

quantinuum.name: Quantinuum
quantinuum.description: Quantinuum is the world's largest integrated quantum computing company. Formed from Honeywell Quantum Solutions and Cambridge Quantum, they build full-stack quantum systems for enterprise and research.

midjourney.name: Midjourney
midjourney.valuation_note: Self-funded, no official valuation. Zero VC.
midjourney.description: Midjourney is the leading AI image generation platform, known for producing stunning, artistic images from text prompts. Operating primarily through Discord, they've built a massive community of artists and creators who use their tool for everything from concept art to professional design work.

sierra.name: Sierra AI
sierra.description: Sierra AI builds conversational AI agents for customer service that feel genuinely helpful, not robotic. Founded by Salesforce co-founders, they focus on empathetic, effective AI interactions.

cerebras.name: Cerebras Systems
cerebras.founders: Andrew Feldman, Gary Lauterbach, Sean Lie, Jean-Philippe Fricker, Michael James
cerebras.description: Cerebras Systems created the world's largest chip, the Wafer Scale Engine, purpose-built for AI training. Their systems dramatically accelerate training of large models and are used by top AI research labs.

ubtech.name: UBTECH Robotics
ubtech.valuation_note: First humanoid company to go public
ubtech.description: UBTECH Robotics creates humanoid robots for education, entertainment, and service. Their Walker robot and lineup of consumer robots have made them a leader in China's robotics industry.

glean.name: Glean
glean.valuation_note: Series F June 2025. $2.2B to $7.2B in 18 months.
glean.founders: Arvind Jain (ex-Google), TR Vishwanath, Tony Gentilcore, Piyush Prahladka
glean.description: Glean is an enterprise AI search platform that understands your company's knowledge across all apps and data sources. Their AI assistant helps employees find information, answer questions, and get work done faster.

cohere.name: Cohere
cohere.founders: Aidan Gomez, Ivan Zhang, Nick Frosst
cohere.description: Cohere provides enterprise-grade large language models for business applications. Their Command and Embed models power RAG systems, semantic search, and text generation across thousands of companies, with a focus on multilingual capabilities and enterprise security.

elevenlabs.name: ElevenLabs
elevenlabs.description: ElevenLabs is the leader in AI voice synthesis, offering hyper-realistic text-to-speech, voice cloning, and dubbing. Their technology powers audiobooks, video games, and content creation, with voices indistinguishable from human speech.

nuro.name: Nuro
nuro.valuation_note: Aug 2025 raise from Uber and Nvidia
nuro.description: Nuro builds autonomous delivery vehicles designed specifically for local commerce. Their driverless vehicles deliver groceries, food, and packages, reimagining last-mile delivery.

shield_ai.name: Shield AI
shield_ai.founders: Brandon Tseng, Ryan Tseng, Andrew Reiter
shield_ai.description: Shield AI develops autonomous systems for defense, including the Hivemind AI pilot that enables aircraft to fly and fight without GPS or communications. Their technology powers multiple military aircraft.

momenta.name: Momenta
momenta.valuation_note: Backed by Tencent, BMW, Toyota. IPO imminent.
momenta.description: Momenta develops autonomous driving technology using a data-driven approach. Their solutions span from advanced driver assistance to full autonomy, deployed with major automakers in China.

helsing.name: Helsing
helsing.founders: Gundbert Scherf, Torsten Reil, Niklas K√∂hler
helsing.description: Helsing is a European defense AI company building software that gives allied forces an edge. Their platform provides AI-powered analysis, targeting, and decision support for military operations.

abridge.name: Abridge
abridge.valuation_note: Series E June 2025. 2x valuation in 4 months.
abridge.description: Abridge uses AI to automatically generate clinical documentation from doctor-patient conversations. Their technology reduces physician burnout by eliminating hours of note-taking while improving documentation accuracy and completeness.

abnormal.name: Abnormal AI
abnormal.description: Abnormal Security uses behavioral AI to stop email attacks that evade traditional security. Their platform detects business email compromise, phishing, and account takeovers with high accuracy.

synthesia.name: Synthesia
synthesia.valuation_note: Oct 2025 led by GV. UK's most valuable GenAI.
synthesia.founders: Victor Riparbelli, Steffen Tjerrild, Lourdes Agapito, Matthias Niessner
synthesia.description: Synthesia is the leading AI video generation platform for enterprises, creating professional videos with AI avatars in 130+ languages. Used by half of Fortune 100 companies for training and marketing.

lambda.name: Lambda Labs
lambda.description: Lambda Labs provides GPU cloud infrastructure purpose-built for AI training and inference. Their on-demand and reserved GPU clusters power research labs and startups, with competitive pricing and deep learning-optimized software stack.

runway.name: Runway
runway.valuation_note: Series D April 2025. Gen-4.5 beats Google/OpenAI.
runway.founders: Crist√≥bal Valenzuela, Alejandro Matamala, Anastasis Germanidis
runway.description: Runway is pioneering AI-powered creative tools for video editing and generation. Their Gen-2 and Gen-3 models enable text-to-video creation, while their suite of AI tools for motion tracking, background removal, and editing has made them essential for filmmakers and content creators.

pika.name: Pika Labs
pika.description: Pika Labs creates AI video generation technology that transforms text and images into high-quality video clips. Their intuitive platform makes video creation accessible to everyone, from social media creators to professional studios.

addepar.name: Addepar
addepar.description: Addepar is the wealth management platform that brings clarity to complex investment portfolios. Their technology aggregates data from thousands of sources, providing advisors and institutions with a unified view of assets across custodians.

replit.name: Replit
replit.founders: Amjad Masad, Faris Masad, Haya Odeh
replit.description: Replit is a browser-based development environment with powerful AI features including Ghostwriter for code generation. They're building the future of collaborative, AI-augmented software development with millions of developers using their platform.

wayve.name: Wayve
wayve.valuation_note: Raised $1.05B from SoftBank. UK's largest AI deal.
wayve.description: Wayve builds autonomous vehicles that learn to drive through experience. Their AV2.0 approach uses end-to-end AI that generalizes across cities, avoiding the brittleness of traditional autonomous systems.

sakana.name: Sakana AI
sakana.founders: Llion Jones, Ren Ito, David Ha
sakana.description: Sakana AI is a Tokyo-based lab founded by former Google researchers, developing AI models inspired by nature and evolution. Their research focuses on efficient, adaptive AI systems using novel architectures beyond traditional transformers.

tenstorrent.name: Tenstorrent
tenstorrent.valuation_note: In talks for $800M at $3B+. Led by Jim Keller.
tenstorrent.founders: Ljubisa Bajic, Jim Keller (ex-Apple, AMD, Tesla)
tenstorrent.description: Tenstorrent, led by legendary chip architect Jim Keller, builds AI processors using RISC-V architecture. Their chips target both training and inference with a focus on efficiency and scalability.

gamma.name: Gamma
gamma.founders: Grant Lee, Jon Noronha, James Fox
gamma.description: Gamma reimagines presentations with AI that generates engaging slides, documents, and websites from your ideas. Their visual-first approach makes creating polished content fast and effortless.

xtalpi.name: XtalPi
xtalpi.description: XtalPi uses quantum physics and AI to predict molecular properties for drug discovery. Their platform accelerates pharmaceutical R&D by simulating how drugs will behave before they're synthesized.

lovable.name: Lovable
lovable.valuation_note: Fastest-growing startup ever. $0 to $100M ARR in 8 months.
lovable.description: Lovable (formerly GPT Engineer) turns natural language into full-stack web applications. You describe what you want, and it generates complete, deployable code with a visual interface for iteration.

writer.name: Writer
writer.description: Writer provides AI writing assistance purpose-built for enterprises, with brand consistency, style guides, and security controls. They help large organizations maintain quality across all written content.

hippocratic.name: Hippocratic AI
hippocratic.description: Hippocratic AI builds AI healthcare agents designed to be safe and effective for patient interactions. Their focus on healthcare-specific training ensures AI assistants that truly understand medical contexts.

sambanova.name: SambaNova Systems
sambanova.founders: Rodrigo Liang, Christopher R√©, Kunle Olukotun
sambanova.description: SambaNova Systems builds AI chips and systems designed for training and inference at enterprise scale. Their Reconfigurable Dataflow Architecture offers an alternative to GPUs for large-scale AI workloads.

jasper.name: Jasper
jasper.founders: Dave Rogenmoser, Chris Hull, John Philip Morgan
jasper.description: Jasper is the AI marketing platform that helps teams create on-brand content at scale. Their tools generate ads, blog posts, and marketing copy while maintaining consistent brand voice.

apptronik.name: Apptronik
apptronik.valuation_note: Series B Feb 2025. Amazon, Walmart, Mercedes.
apptronik.founders: Jeff Cardenas, Nick Paine, Luis Sentis
apptronik.description: Apptronik builds humanoid robots designed for real-world work. Their Apollo robot is being developed for manufacturing, logistics, and other industries where human-form robots can integrate naturally.

intercom.name: Intercom
intercom.valuation_note: Invested $100M in AI. Fin answered 13M inquiries.
intercom.description: Intercom is a customer service platform powered by AI, featuring Fin, an AI agent that resolves customer issues automatically. They combine chatbots, help centers, and human support into one seamless experience.

tines.name: Tines
tines.description: Tines is the smart, secure workflow platform for enterprise security teams. Their no-code automation enables security operations to build sophisticated playbooks without programming.

together_ai.name: Together AI
together_ai.valuation_note: GPU cloud for startups. Pay per token.
together_ai.founders: Vipul Ved Prakash, Ce Zhang, Percy Liang, Christopher R√©
together_ai.description: Together AI provides cloud infrastructure optimized for open-source LLMs. Their platform offers the fastest inference speeds for models like Llama and Mixtral, with competitive pricing that makes open AI models practical for production use.

resolve.name: Resolve AI
resolve.description: Resolve AI automates customer support with AI agents that handle complex issues. Their technology goes beyond simple chatbots to truly resolve problems, reducing ticket volume while improving satisfaction.

world_labs.name: World Labs
world_labs.description: World Labs is an AI company founded by Fei-Fei Li, the legendary Stanford professor who created ImageNet. They're building large world models that understand spatial intelligence and physics, aiming to give AI systems genuine understanding of the 3D world.

insilico.name: Insilico Medicine
insilico.description: Insilico Medicine uses AI to discover new drugs and identify targets for diseases of aging. They've advanced multiple AI-discovered drugs to clinical trials, validating their end-to-end platform.

sanctuary_ai.name: Sanctuary AI
sanctuary_ai.description: Sanctuary AI is building humanoid robots with human-like intelligence. Their Phoenix robot combines advanced AI with human form to work in unstructured environments alongside people.

dream_security.name: Dream Security
dream_security.description: Dream Security provides AI-powered security operations for enterprise. Their platform uses advanced AI to detect threats, automate response, and reduce the burden on security teams.

sardine.name: Sardine
sardine.valuation_note: Series C Feb 2025. AI fraud prevention.
sardine.description: Sardine provides fraud and compliance infrastructure for fintech. Their platform uses device intelligence and behavioral biometrics to detect fraud and money laundering in real-time.

decagon.name: Decagon
decagon.description: Decagon builds enterprise-grade AI support agents that handle customer conversations autonomously. Their platform integrates with existing systems to resolve issues with human-like understanding and accuracy.

heygen.name: HeyGen
heygen.description: HeyGen creates AI-generated videos with realistic avatars that speak any language. Their technology powers marketing, training, and communication videos without cameras or actors.

aleph_alpha.name: Aleph Alpha
aleph_alpha.description: Aleph Alpha is building sovereign European AI infrastructure and foundation models. Their Luminous models serve government and enterprise clients requiring data sovereignty and transparency.

hawk_ai.name: Hawk AI
hawk_ai.description: Hawk AI fights financial crime with AI-powered surveillance and screening. Their platform helps banks and fintechs detect money laundering, fraud, and sanctions violations more effectively.

reflection_ai.name: Reflection AI
reflection_ai.valuation_note: Raised $2B. Open frontier AI lab challenging DeepSeek.
reflection_ai.description: Reflection AI is developing next-generation language models with improved reasoning and self-reflection capabilities. Their research focuses on models that can evaluate their own outputs and iteratively improve their responses for greater accuracy.

physical_intelligence.name: Physical Intelligence
physical_intelligence.valuation_note: Series B Nov 2025. 'Android for robots' - $300/month per robot.
physical_intelligence.founders: Karol Hausman, Sergey Levine, Chelsea Finn, Brian Ichter
physical_intelligence.description: Physical Intelligence (œÄ) is building foundation models for robotics. Their approach brings the generalization capabilities of large language models to physical AI systems.

sandboxaq.name: SandboxAQ
sandboxaq.valuation_note: Series E $450M. Alphabet spinout. TIME100 Most Influential 2025.
sandboxaq.description: SandboxAQ applies AI and quantum technologies to solve complex enterprise problems. Their platforms address drug discovery, cybersecurity, and financial modeling with advanced computational approaches.

codeium.name: Codeium
codeium.description: Codeium provides free AI code completion and chat for developers, supporting 70+ languages across all major IDEs. Their Windsurf agentic IDE and enterprise features compete directly with GitHub Copilot.

n8n.name: n8n
n8n.valuation_note: Series C led by Accel. AI agent automation platform.
n8n.description: n8n is the open-source workflow automation platform that gives you full control over your data and deployments. Their visual builder and self-hosting options appeal to technical teams.

langchain.name: LangChain
langchain.valuation_note: Series B led by IVP. AI agent deployment platform.
langchain.description: LangChain is the most popular framework for building LLM-powered applications. Their tools for chaining prompts, connecting to data sources, and building agents have become essential infrastructure for AI app developers.

enveda.name: Enveda Biosciences
enveda.valuation_note: Series D $150M. AI mines nature for drugs.
enveda.description: Enveda Biosciences uses AI to discover medicines from nature's chemistry. Their platform analyzes plants and natural products to find new drug candidates, combining traditional knowledge with modern AI.

insitro.name: Insitro
insitro.valuation_note: ML for drug discovery. Partnership with Bristol Myers Squibb.
insitro.description: Insitro combines machine learning with biological data to discover and develop drugs. Their approach generates rich datasets from human cell models to predict clinical outcomes.

imbue.name: Imbue
imbue.description: Imbue is building AI systems that can reason and collaborate with humans. Their research focuses on developing AI agents that understand user intent and work effectively on complex, open-ended tasks.

baseten.name: Baseten
baseten.founders: Tuhin Srivastava, Amir Haghighat, Philip Howes
baseten.description: Baseten provides inference infrastructure optimized for machine learning models. Their platform handles the complexity of deploying, scaling, and monitoring ML in production, trusted by companies processing millions of AI requests daily.

modal.name: Modal
modal.description: Modal is serverless infrastructure that makes running Python in the cloud feel like running it locally. Their platform handles GPU allocation, scaling, and orchestration automatically, perfect for AI workloads that need to scale dynamically.

character_ai.name: Character.AI
character_ai.valuation_note: Google licensing deal $2.5B. Founders returned to Google.
character_ai.founders: Noam Shazeer, Daniel De Freitas (ex-Google LaMDA)
character_ai.description: Character.AI lets users create and chat with AI characters, from fictional personas to educational tutors. With billions of messages exchanged, they've built one of the most engaged AI consumer products.

typeface.name: Typeface
typeface.description: Typeface is the generative AI platform for enterprise content creation. Their technology enables brands to create on-brand marketing content at scale while maintaining consistency and compliance.

anthropic_spinout.name: Goodfire
anthropic_spinout.description: Goodfire is an AI interpretability company spun out of Anthropic, focused on understanding how neural networks actually work. Their research aims to make AI systems more transparent and trustworthy by revealing the internal mechanisms of large language models.

fixed_ai.name: Fix
fixed_ai.description: Fix is an AI-powered development platform that automatically fixes bugs and issues in code. Their system analyzes errors, understands context, and generates corrections, streamlining the debugging process for development teams.

dbt_labs.name: dbt Labs
dbt_labs.founders: Tristan Handy, Drew Banin, Connor McArthur
dbt_labs.description: dbt Labs created the analytics engineering workflow with dbt (data build tool). Their platform helps data teams transform raw data into trusted datasets using software engineering best practices.

hex.name: Hex
hex.founders: Barry McCardel, Caitlin Colgrove, Glen Takahashi
hex.description: Hex is the modern data workspace where teams collaborate on analytics with notebooks, SQL, and AI. Their platform combines the best of notebooks and BI tools with powerful collaboration features.

fivetran.name: Fivetran
fivetran.description: Fivetran automates data integration, syncing data from hundreds of sources into your warehouse. Their platform eliminates the engineering work of building and maintaining data pipelines.

airbyte.name: Airbyte
airbyte.description: Airbyte is the open-source data integration platform with 300+ connectors. Their EL(T) approach enables data teams to sync data from any source to any destination.

pinecone.name: Pinecone
pinecone.description: Pinecone is the most popular vector database, enabling semantic search and AI memory at scale. Their managed service makes it easy to build RAG applications and AI features that truly understand meaning.

qdrant.name: Qdrant
qdrant.description: Qdrant is a high-performance vector similarity search engine built in Rust. Their open-source database excels at filtering, payload handling, and scaling to billions of vectors.

weaviate.name: Weaviate
weaviate.description: Weaviate is an open-source vector database that stores data objects and vector embeddings for semantic search and AI applications. Their hybrid search combines vector similarity with traditional filtering.

luma_ai.name: Luma AI
luma_ai.description: Luma AI creates photorealistic 3D captures and AI-generated videos. Their Dream Machine model generates high-quality video from text, while their 3D scanning makes reality capture accessible.

snowflake.name: Snowflake
snowflake.founders: Benoit Dageville, Thierry Cruanes, Marcin Zukowski
snowflake.description: Snowflake is the data cloud company that has expanded into AI with Cortex, their suite of AI services. Built on their data warehouse platform used by thousands of enterprises, Snowflake Cortex brings LLMs and ML directly to where enterprise data lives.

palantir.name: Palantir Technologies
palantir.valuation_note: NASDAQ: PLTR. 22nd most valuable company globally.
palantir.founders: Peter Thiel, Alex Karp, Joe Lonsdale, Stephen Cohen, Nathan Gettings
palantir.description: Palantir builds data integration and AI platforms for government and enterprise. Their Gotham and Foundry platforms help organizations make sense of complex data for critical decisions.

nvidia.name: NVIDIA
nvidia.valuation_note: NASDAQ: NVDA. World's most valuable company.
nvidia.founders: Jensen Huang, Chris Malachowsky, Curtis Priem
nvidia.description: NVIDIA dominates AI computing with GPUs that power virtually all AI training and inference. Their H100 and upcoming Blackwell chips, combined with CUDA software ecosystem, make them the most valuable semiconductor company in the world.

google_deepmind.name: Google DeepMind
google_deepmind.valuation_note: Alphabet subsidiary. Created AlphaGo, AlphaFold, Gemini.
google_deepmind.founders: Demis Hassabis, Shane Legg, Mustafa Suleyman
google_deepmind.description: Google DeepMind combines two of the world's premier AI research labs into one powerhouse. Their work spans from AlphaFold's solution to protein structure prediction to Gemini, pushing the boundaries of what AI can achieve in science and applications.

meta_ai.name: Meta AI (Llama)
meta_ai.description: Meta AI develops Llama, the leading open-source large language model family. Their research advances computer vision, language understanding, and mixed reality, powering AI features across Meta's products.

waymo.name: Waymo
waymo.founders: Sebastian Thrun (originally Google Self-Driving Car Project)
waymo.description: Waymo is the autonomous driving subsidiary of Alphabet, operating commercial robotaxi services in multiple US cities. With millions of miles of real-world driving, they're the leader in deploying self-driving technology at scale.

boston_dynamics.name: Boston Dynamics
boston_dynamics.valuation_note: 80% owned by Hyundai. Could be worth $25B+ if commercialized.
boston_dynamics.description: Boston Dynamics creates the world's most advanced mobile robots, from Spot the robot dog to Atlas the humanoid. Their robots demonstrate remarkable agility and are used for inspection, safety, and research.

uipath.name: UiPath
uipath.description: UiPath is the leader in robotic process automation (RPA), using AI to automate repetitive business processes. Their platform combines software robots with AI to handle complex workflows.

github_copilot.name: GitHub Copilot
github_copilot.description: GitHub Copilot is the AI pair programmer that transformed software development. Integrated into popular IDEs, it suggests code completions, generates functions, and explains code, used by millions of developers worldwide.

sora.name: OpenAI Sora
sora.description: Sora is OpenAI's breakthrough text-to-video model that generates realistic, minute-long videos from prompts. Its understanding of physics and motion represents a major leap in AI video generation, with implications for film, advertising, and creative industries.

tesla_optimus.name: Tesla Optimus
tesla_optimus.valuation_note: Tesla humanoid robot division. Mass production 2025.
tesla_optimus.description: Tesla Optimus is the humanoid robot Elon Musk envisions handling dangerous and repetitive work. Leveraging Tesla's AI and manufacturing expertise, it aims to address labor shortages with human-form automation.

servicenow.name: ServiceNow
servicenow.description: ServiceNow is the enterprise workflow platform that digitizes and automates business processes. Their Now Platform AI capabilities transform how organizations manage IT, HR, customer service, and more.

crowdstrike.name: CrowdStrike
crowdstrike.description: CrowdStrike is the leader in cloud-native endpoint security, using AI to detect and prevent cyber threats in real-time. Their Falcon platform protects millions of endpoints worldwide with industry-leading threat intelligence.

adobe_firefly.name: Adobe Firefly
adobe_firefly.description: Adobe Firefly is Adobe's family of generative AI models trained on licensed content. Integrated into Photoshop, Illustrator, and other Creative Cloud apps, it enables professional-safe AI generation for commercial work.

zendesk.name: Zendesk
zendesk.founders: Mikkel Svane, Alexander Aghassipour, Morten Primdahl
zendesk.description: Zendesk is the customer service platform trusted by 100,000+ businesses, now enhanced with AI for automated responses, agent assistance, and intelligent ticket routing.

zapier.name: Zapier
zapier.founders: Wade Foster, Bryan Helmig, Mike Knoop
zapier.description: Zapier connects 6,000+ apps to automate workflows without code. Their AI features now help users build automations with natural language, making process automation accessible to everyone.

agility_robotics.name: Agility Robotics
agility_robotics.description: Agility Robotics builds Digit, a human-centric robot designed to work in spaces built for people. Their bipedal robot navigates stairs, carries boxes, and collaborates safely with human workers.

tabnine.name: Tabnine
tabnine.description: Tabnine provides AI code completion that runs locally or in the cloud, with a focus on privacy and enterprise security. They support all major languages and IDEs with personalized suggestions.

replicate.name: Replicate
replicate.description: Replicate lets developers run open-source AI models with a single API call. Their platform hosts thousands of models from image generators to language models, making cutting-edge AI accessible without managing infrastructure.

labelbox.name: Labelbox
labelbox.founders: Manu Sharma, Brian Rieger, Dan Rasmuson
labelbox.description: Labelbox is the leading data labeling platform for training AI models. Their tools for annotation, model-assisted labeling, and data curation help teams build high-quality training datasets faster, with over 30% of Fortune 500 companies as customers.

coveo.name: Coveo
coveo.valuation_note: TSX: CVO. Enterprise search and AI.
coveo.description: Coveo provides AI-powered search and recommendations for enterprises. Their platform understands user intent to deliver relevant results across websites, commerce, and service applications.

aws_sagemaker.name: Amazon SageMaker
aws_sagemaker.description: Amazon's fully managed machine learning service for building, training, and deploying ML models at scale.

aws_bedrock.name: Amazon Bedrock
aws_bedrock.description: Amazon's managed service providing access to foundation models from AI21 Labs, Anthropic, Cohere, Meta, Stability AI, and Amazon.

amazon_q.name: Amazon Q
amazon_q.description: Amazon Q is AWS's generative AI assistant for business and development. It helps developers write code, troubleshoot errors, and build on AWS, while business users analyze data and automate workflows with natural language.

amazon_titan.name: Amazon Titan
amazon_titan.description: Amazon Titan is AWS's family of foundation models for text, images, and embeddings. Available through Bedrock, these models enable enterprises to build generative AI applications on AWS infrastructure with consistent quality.

aws.name: Amazon Web Services
aws.description: Amazon Web Services dominates cloud computing with AI services from SageMaker to Bedrock. Their AI/ML infrastructure supports model training, deployment, and inference at massive scale for enterprises worldwide.

aws_redshift.name: Amazon Redshift
aws_redshift.description: Amazon Redshift is the cloud data warehouse that scales from gigabytes to petabytes. Its machine learning capabilities enable predictive analytics directly on enterprise data.

google_cloud.name: Google Cloud Platform
google_cloud.description: Google Cloud Platform provides enterprise cloud services powered by Google's AI. From BigQuery to Vertex AI, it enables businesses to build on the same infrastructure as Google.

google_vertex.name: Google Vertex AI
google_vertex.description: Google Vertex AI is the unified ML platform for training and deploying models. It provides access to Gemini models, AutoML, and MLOps tools for enterprise AI development.

google_bigquery.name: Google BigQuery
google_bigquery.description: Google BigQuery is the serverless data warehouse with built-in machine learning. Its BigQuery ML enables analysts to build and deploy models using SQL, bringing AI to data teams without specialized infrastructure.

google_gemini.name: Google Gemini
google_gemini.description: Google Gemini is Google's most capable AI model family, natively multimodal from the ground up. Available through Google AI Studio and Vertex AI, Gemini competes directly with GPT-4 across reasoning, coding, and multimodal tasks.

google_deepmind_robotics.name: Google DeepMind Robotics
google_deepmind_robotics.description: Google DeepMind Robotics applies AI research to physical robots. Their work on robot learning and manipulation advances the science of embodied intelligence.
google_deepmind_robotics.founders: DeepMind (Demis Hassabis, Shane Legg, Mustafa Suleyman)

google_quantum.name: Google Quantum AI
google_quantum.description: Google Quantum AI advances quantum computing hardware and algorithms. Their Sycamore processor achieved quantum supremacy, and they continue pushing toward practical quantum advantage.

google_search.name: Google Search
google_search.description: Google Search processes over 8.5 billion queries daily using AI for ranking, understanding, and generation. Its AI Overviews and continuous algorithm improvements keep it the world's primary gateway to information.

google_cloud_search.name: Google Cloud Search
google_cloud_search.description: Google Cloud Search brings Google-quality search to enterprise data. Its AI understands queries and finds relevant information across Google Workspace and third-party sources, helping employees find what they need instantly.

azure_openai.name: Azure OpenAI Service
azure_openai.description: Azure OpenAI Service brings GPT-4, DALL-E, and other OpenAI models to Microsoft's enterprise cloud. It combines OpenAI's capabilities with Azure's security, compliance, and enterprise features for business AI deployment.

microsoft_copilot.name: Microsoft Copilot
microsoft_copilot.description: Microsoft Copilot brings AI assistance across Microsoft 365, Windows, and Edge. It helps users write documents, analyze data, create presentations, and code, integrating GPT-4 into the tools billions use daily.

microsoft_fabric.name: Microsoft Fabric
microsoft_fabric.description: Microsoft's unified analytics platform combining data lake, data warehouse, and real-time analytics.

microsoft_power_automate.name: Microsoft Power Automate
microsoft_power_automate.description: Microsoft Power Automate enables workflow automation with AI capabilities. Users create automated processes across Microsoft 365 and hundreds of other services with low-code tools.

github_copilot_workspace.name: GitHub Copilot Workspace
github_copilot_workspace.description: GitHub Copilot Workspace is the AI-native development environment. It turns natural language task descriptions into implemented code changes across entire repositories.

github_codespaces.name: GitHub Codespaces
github_codespaces.description: GitHub Codespaces provides cloud-hosted development environments. Developers launch pre-configured workspaces in seconds, with AI assistance through Copilot integration.

jetbrains_ai.name: JetBrains AI
jetbrains_ai.description: JetBrains AI brings intelligent assistance to PyCharm, IntelliJ, and other IDEs. Their AI features help developers write, understand, and refactor code in familiar environments.

sourcegraph_cody.name: Sourcegraph Cody
sourcegraph_cody.description: Sourcegraph Cody is the AI coding assistant that understands your entire codebase. It answers questions, generates code, and explains systems with full repository context.

gitpod.name: Gitpod
gitpod.description: Gitpod provides cloud development environments that launch in seconds. Their platform automates development setup, giving teams consistent, reproducible workspaces that eliminate 'works on my machine' problems.
gitpod.founders: Sven Efftinge, Moritz Eysholdt, Johannes Landgraf

stackblitz.name: StackBlitz
stackblitz.description: StackBlitz runs full development environments entirely in the browser. Their WebContainer technology enables instant, shareable dev environments that work offline, revolutionizing how developers prototype and collaborate.

vercel_v0.name: Vercel v0
vercel_v0.description: Vercel v0 generates React UI components from natural language. Designers and developers describe interfaces in plain English and get production-ready, shadcn-based code.

gptengineer.name: GPT Engineer
gptengineer.description: GPT Engineer (Lovable) generates full-stack web applications from prompts. Users describe their app in natural language and get complete, deployable code with a visual interface.

autogpt.name: AutoGPT
autogpt.description: AutoGPT pioneered autonomous AI agents that chain together LLM calls to accomplish goals. Their framework inspired a generation of agent-based AI systems.

deepseek.name: DeepSeek
deepseek.description: DeepSeek is a Chinese AI research company that has produced remarkably capable open-weight language models. Their DeepSeek-V2 and DeepSeek-Coder models compete with leading Western models while being significantly more efficient and openly available.

you_com.name: You.com
you_com.description: You.com is an AI search engine built for developers and researchers. Their platform combines web search with AI chat, code execution, and specialized modes for different use cases.
you_com.founders: Richard Socher (ex-Salesforce Chief Scientist), Bryan McCann

phind.name: Phind
phind.description: Phind is the AI search engine optimized for developers. It understands technical questions and provides code-focused answers, becoming an essential tool for programmers seeking solutions.

kagi.name: Kagi
kagi.description: Kagi is a premium, ad-free search engine with AI features. Their subscription model prioritizes user experience over advertising, with powerful customization and AI summarization.

llamaindex.name: LlamaIndex
llamaindex.description: LlamaIndex is the data framework for LLM applications. Their tools for indexing, retrieval, and RAG enable developers to build AI that understands private data.

langsmith.name: LangSmith
langsmith.description: LangSmith is LangChain's platform for debugging, testing, and monitoring LLM applications. Their tools trace execution, evaluate outputs, and manage the lifecycle of AI applications at any scale.

langchain_agents.name: LangChain Agents
langchain_agents.description: LangChain Agents enable LLMs to use tools and take actions. This capability transforms language models from text generators into systems that can accomplish real-world tasks.

semantic_kernel.name: Semantic Kernel
semantic_kernel.description: Semantic Kernel is Microsoft's SDK for integrating LLMs into applications. It provides patterns for memory, planning, and tool use in enterprise AI development.

haystack.name: Haystack
haystack.description: Haystack is the open-source framework for building NLP applications. Their pipelines make it easy to create search systems, question answering, and RAG applications.
haystack.founders: Deepset (Milos Rusic, Malte Pietsch, Timo M√∂ller)

chroma.name: Chroma
chroma.description: Chroma is the AI-native open-source embedding database designed for LLM applications. Their simple API makes it easy to store, search, and retrieve embeddings for RAG and other AI use cases.

milvus.name: Milvus
milvus.description: Milvus is the open-source vector database for AI applications. Their distributed architecture handles billion-scale similarity search for recommendations and RAG systems.

mongodb_vector.name: MongoDB Atlas Vector Search
mongodb_vector.description: MongoDB Atlas Vector Search brings semantic search to the document database. Developers add vector search to MongoDB applications for AI features without a separate database.

elastic.name: Elastic
elastic.description: Elasticsearch powers search and observability for thousands of companies. Their AI-enhanced platform enables real-time search, analytics, and machine learning across enterprise data.
elastic.founders: Shay Banon, Steven Schuurman, Uri Boness

elasticsearch.name: Elasticsearch
elasticsearch.description: Open-source distributed search engine with vector search capabilities.
elasticsearch.founders: Shay Banon, Steven Schuurman, Uri Boness

weights_biases.name: Weights & Biases
weights_biases.description: Weights & Biases (W&B) is the MLOps platform used by over 200,000 machine learning practitioners. Their tools for experiment tracking, model versioning, and collaboration have become essential infrastructure for teams training AI models at any scale.
weights_biases.founders: Lukas Biewald, Chris Van Pelt, Shawn Lewis

mlflow.name: MLflow
mlflow.description: Open-source platform for ML lifecycle management including experiment tracking.

anyscale.name: Anyscale
anyscale.description: Anyscale provides the Ray platform for building scalable AI applications. Their technology, born at UC Berkeley, powers distributed training and serving at companies like OpenAI, Uber, and Spotify, handling some of the largest AI workloads in the world.
anyscale.founders: Robert Nishihara, Philipp Moritz, Ion Stoica

coreweave.name: CoreWeave
coreweave.description: CoreWeave provides GPU cloud infrastructure optimized for AI workloads. Their NVIDIA-powered platform offers on-demand and reserved capacity for training and inference at competitive prices.
coreweave.founders: Michael Intrator, Brian Venturo, Brannin McBee

runpod.name: RunPod
runpod.description: RunPod is the GPU cloud platform that makes deploying AI models simple and affordable. Their serverless and pod-based infrastructure serves hundreds of thousands of developers building AI applications, from hobbyists to enterprises.

banana.name: Banana
banana.description: Banana provides serverless GPU infrastructure for deploying machine learning models. Their platform lets developers deploy models with a single line of code, handling scaling automatically.

appen.name: Appen
appen.description: Appen provides high-quality training data for AI and machine learning. They source data from a global crowd workforce, helping companies train accurate AI models across languages and use cases.

sama.name: Sama
sama.description: Sama provides training data and annotation services for AI companies. They combine ethical outsourcing with quality data labeling, helping train models while creating jobs in underserved communities.

surge_ai.name: Surge AI
surge_ai.description: Surge AI provides high-quality data labeling for AI companies through a curated workforce. Their platform delivers accurate annotations for NLP, computer vision, and other ML applications.

roboflow.name: Roboflow
roboflow.description: Computer vision platform for building, training, and deploying vision AI models.

dall_e.name: DALL-E
dall_e.description: DALL-E is OpenAI's AI system that creates realistic images from text descriptions. Its ability to generate novel visual concepts has transformed creative workflows for millions of users.

adobe_express.name: Adobe Express
adobe_express.description: Adobe Express brings AI-powered design to everyone. Its templates, generative AI features, and simple editing tools enable anyone to create professional content quickly.

canva.name: Canva
canva.description: Canva democratized design with easy-to-use tools, and now leads with AI features like Magic Design, text-to-image generation, and AI writing. Used by over 170 million people worldwide.
canva.founders: Melanie Perkins, Cliff Obrecht, Cameron Adams

veo.name: Google Veo
veo.description: Google Veo is DeepMind's text-to-video model that generates high-quality video from prompts. Its understanding of physics and cinematography enables compelling video creation.

kling.name: Kling AI
kling.description: Chinese text-to-video AI model from Kuaishou with impressive quality.

haiper.name: Haiper
haiper.description: Haiper AI creates high-quality AI-generated videos from text and images. Founded by Google DeepMind researchers, their technology pushes the boundaries of video synthesis with improved temporal consistency and motion quality.

ideogram.name: Ideogram
ideogram.description: Ideogram specializes in AI image generation with industry-best text rendering. Their models accurately generate images with readable text, logos, and typography that other AI struggles with.
ideogram.founders: Mohammad Norouzi, William Peebles, Jonathan Ho (ex-Google Brain)

leonardo_ai.name: Leonardo.ai
leonardo_ai.description: Leonardo.ai generates images and creative assets using AI. Their platform helps game developers, artists, and creators produce high-quality visuals quickly with fine-tuned models.

wonder_dynamics.name: Wonder Dynamics
wonder_dynamics.description: Wonder Dynamics automates VFX work using AI, replacing manual processes with intelligent automation. Their Wonder Studio can automatically animate, light, and composite CG characters into live-action scenes.

descript.name: Descript
descript.description: Descript is an all-in-one audio/video editor where editing media is as easy as editing text. Their Overdub feature lets you generate speech in your own voice or choose from AI voices.

invideo.name: InVideo
invideo.description: InVideo is an AI-powered video creation platform for marketers and creators. Their tools automate editing, add effects, and generate videos from text prompts in minutes.
invideo.founders: Sanket Shah, Harsh Vakharia, Pankit Chheda

openai_voice.name: OpenAI Voice
openai_voice.description: OpenAI's text-to-speech and voice cloning capabilities.

play_ht.name: PlayHT
play_ht.description: PlayHT offers ultra-realistic AI voice generation with 900+ voices in 140+ languages. Their technology powers podcasts, audiobooks, and voice-overs with emotion control and voice cloning.

murf.name: Murf AI
murf.description: Murf AI provides studio-quality voice-overs in minutes with AI voices indistinguishable from humans. Their platform serves marketers, educators, and content creators with easy voice generation.
murf.founders: Sneha Roy, Ankur Edkie, Divyanshu Pandey

resemble.name: Resemble AI
resemble.description: Resemble AI offers real-time voice cloning and synthesis for developers. Their API powers voice experiences in games, apps, and customer service with customizable AI voices.

colossyan.name: Colossyan
colossyan.description: Colossyan creates AI video with photorealistic digital avatars for enterprise communication. Their platform enables companies to produce training videos, marketing content, and internal communications at scale without traditional video production.
colossyan.founders: Dominik Deak, Kristof Szabo, Zoltan Kovacs

d_id.name: D-ID
d_id.description: D-ID specializes in AI-generated talking avatars and video, powering creative agents that can hold conversations. Their technology brings photos and illustrations to life with natural speech and expressions.
d_id.founders: Gil Perry, Sella Blondheim, Eliran Kuta

hour_one.name: Hour One
hour_one.description: Hour One generates professional videos with AI-powered virtual presenters. Their lifelike avatars can deliver content in multiple languages, enabling global enterprises to create personalized video at unprecedented scale.

tavus.name: Tavus
tavus.description: Tavus creates personalized AI videos at scale by cloning faces and voices with permission. Their technology enables one-to-many personalized communication, transforming how businesses connect with customers.

grammarly.name: Grammarly
grammarly.description: Grammarly is the AI writing assistant used by 30 million people daily, offering grammar checking, style suggestions, and tone adjustments. GrammarlyGO adds generative AI for drafting and rewriting.
grammarly.founders: Alex Shevchenko, Max Lytvyn, Dmytro Lider

copy_ai.name: Copy.ai
copy_ai.description: Copy.ai uses AI to generate marketing copy, blog posts, and business content. Their platform helps marketers create high-converting content at scale with minimal effort.

anyword.name: Anyword
anyword.description: Anyword uses AI to generate and optimize marketing copy that converts. Their platform predicts content performance, helping marketers create effective messaging across channels and audiences.

notion_ai.name: Notion AI
notion_ai.description: Notion AI brings artificial intelligence to the popular workspace tool, helping users write, summarize, brainstorm, and extract insights from their notes and documents.

tome.name: Tome
tome.description: Tome is the AI-native presentation tool that generates beautiful slide decks from prompts. It helps teams create compelling narratives with AI-generated content, images, and layouts.

pitch.name: Pitch
pitch.description: Pitch is a collaborative presentation platform with AI-powered features. Teams use it to create beautiful decks together with smart templates and design automation.

beautiful_ai.name: Beautiful.ai
beautiful_ai.description: Beautiful.ai uses AI to transform how presentations are designed. Their smart templates automatically adjust layouts as you add content, ensuring every slide looks professionally designed.

moveworks.name: Moveworks
moveworks.description: Moveworks uses AI to automate IT support and resolve employee requests. Their platform handles tickets autonomously, freeing IT teams to focus on strategic work.
moveworks.founders: Bhavin Shah, Vaibhav Nivargi, Jiang Chen, Varun Singh

forethought.name: Forethought
forethought.description: Forethought provides AI for customer support that predicts, prioritizes, and resolves tickets. Their platform integrates with existing helpdesks to automate responses and assist agents.

ada.name: Ada
ada.description: Ada is an AI-powered customer service automation platform that resolves inquiries without human intervention. Their AI agents handle complex conversations across channels in any language, trusted by leading brands worldwide.

ultimate_ai.name: Ultimate.ai
ultimate_ai.description: Ultimate.ai provides AI-powered customer support automation. Their virtual agents handle conversations across channels, reducing response times and support costs.

drift.name: Drift
drift.description: Drift provides conversational AI for B2B sales and marketing. Their chatbots qualify leads, book meetings, and accelerate the buyer journey 24/7.

freshdesk.name: Freshdesk
freshdesk.description: Customer support software with AI-powered automation.

freshservice.name: Freshservice
freshservice.description: IT service management platform with AI capabilities.

automation_anywhere.name: Automation Anywhere
automation_anywhere.description: Automation Anywhere provides enterprise RPA with AI-powered automation. Their bots handle repetitive tasks across applications, freeing employees for higher-value work.
automation_anywhere.founders: Ankur Kothari, Mikhail Naumov, Neeti Mehta

workato.name: Workato
workato.description: Workato provides enterprise automation and integration with AI-powered recommendations. Their platform helps large organizations connect systems and automate processes at scale.

tray_io.name: Tray.io
tray_io.description: Tray.io is an integration platform that connects apps and automates workflows. Their AI-enhanced platform helps businesses build complex automations without coding.
tray_io.founders: Rich Waldron, Alistair Russell, Dominic Lewis

make.name: Make (Integromat)
make.description: Make (formerly Integromat) is a visual automation platform for connecting apps and building complex workflows. Their powerful scenario builder enables sophisticated integrations without programming.

pega.name: Pegasystems
pega.description: Pegasystems provides AI-powered software for customer engagement and workflow automation. Their platform helps enterprises streamline operations and deliver personalized experiences.

darktrace.name: Darktrace
darktrace.description: Darktrace uses self-learning AI to detect and respond to cyber threats in real-time. Their technology understands normal behavior and spots anomalies across networks, cloud, and email.
darktrace.founders: Poppy Gustafsson, Dave Palmer, Emily Sherrett, Jack Sherrett
darktrace.funding: Was public (DARK.L), acquired by Thoma Bravo

sentinelone.name: SentinelOne
sentinelone.description: SentinelOne provides autonomous endpoint security powered by AI that prevents, detects, and responds to attacks without human intervention. Their platform protects enterprises from sophisticated threats.

tessian.name: Tessian
tessian.description: Tessian uses AI to prevent email security breaches and data loss. Their platform detects phishing, misdirected emails, and unauthorized data sharing automatically.
tessian.founders: Tim Sherborne, Ed Bishop, Tom Adams

ironscales.name: Ironscales
ironscales.description: Ironscales provides AI-powered email security that stops phishing attacks. Their platform combines machine learning with human insights to protect enterprises from threats.

mimecast.name: Mimecast
mimecast.description: Mimecast provides AI-enhanced email security and cyber resilience. Their cloud platform protects against advanced threats while ensuring email continuity and compliance.

swimlane.name: Swimlane
swimlane.description: Swimlane provides security orchestration, automation, and response (SOAR). Their AI-powered platform helps security teams automate workflows and respond to threats faster.

proofpoint.name: Proofpoint
proofpoint.description: Proofpoint provides AI-driven cybersecurity for email, cloud, and data protection. Their platform defends against advanced threats targeting people and data.

palo_alto.name: Palo Alto Networks
palo_alto.description: Palo Alto Networks is a leading cybersecurity company using AI across their platform. Their solutions protect networks, cloud, and endpoints with intelligent threat detection.

nuance_dax.name: Nuance DAX
nuance_dax.description: AI-powered clinical documentation assistant for healthcare.

nuance.name: Nuance Communications
nuance.description: AI healthcare and speech recognition pioneer, powering clinical documentation.

suki.name: Suki AI
suki.description: Suki AI is a voice assistant for doctors that automates clinical documentation. Physicians dictate notes naturally, and Suki transcribes them into structured EHR entries.

deepscribe.name: DeepScribe
deepscribe.description: DeepScribe uses AI to automatically generate medical documentation from patient visits. Their ambient AI scribe listens to conversations and creates accurate clinical notes.

ambience.name: Ambience Healthcare
ambience.description: Ambience Healthcare provides AI-powered clinical documentation that captures patient encounters automatically. Their platform reduces physician burnout while improving note quality and compliance.

nabla.name: Nabla
nabla.description: Nabla builds AI copilots for healthcare professionals, automating documentation and clinical workflows. Their technology helps doctors work more efficiently while maintaining high-quality patient care.

tempus.name: Tempus AI
tempus.description: Tempus uses AI to analyze clinical and molecular data, helping doctors make more informed treatment decisions. Their platform has built one of the world's largest libraries of clinical and molecular data.

schrodinger.name: Schr√∂dinger
schrodinger.description: Schr√∂dinger uses computational methods and AI to accelerate drug discovery. Their physics-based simulations help identify promising molecules before synthesis.

exscientia.name: Exscientia
exscientia.description: Exscientia designs drugs using AI, achieving industry firsts in bringing AI-designed molecules to clinical trials. Their platform handles the full drug design process from target to candidate.

relay_therapeutics.name: Relay Therapeutics
relay_therapeutics.description: Relay Therapeutics uses AI and computational biology to design precision medicines. Their Dynamo platform simulates protein motion to discover drugs that target previously undruggable proteins.

absci.name: Absci
absci.description: Absci uses AI to design novel antibodies and proteins for drug development. Their platform combines machine learning with synthetic biology to accelerate biopharmaceutical discovery.

cruise.name: Cruise
cruise.description: Cruise is GM's autonomous vehicle unit, developing self-driving cars for urban environments. They operate robotaxi services and are working toward fully driverless vehicles without safety drivers.

mobileye.name: Mobileye
mobileye.description: Mobileye, an Intel company, provides autonomous driving technology and advanced driver assistance systems. Their chips and software power ADAS features in over 800 vehicle models.
mobileye.funding: Intel acquired for $15.3B (2017). IPO 2022, $16B market cap

aurora.name: Aurora Innovation
aurora.description: Aurora is building the self-driving system for trucks and passenger vehicles. Their Aurora Driver aims to be the platform that enables autonomous transportation at scale across vehicle types.
aurora.founders: Chris Urmson (ex-Google), Sterling Anderson (ex-Tesla), Drew Bagnell (ex-Uber)

motional.name: Motional
motional.description: Motional develops autonomous driving technology for safer roads. The joint venture between Hyundai and Aptiv builds driverless systems for robotaxis and ride-hailing services.

zoox.name: Zoox
zoox.description: Zoox, an Amazon company, is building autonomous vehicles designed from the ground up for robotaxi service. Their bidirectional vehicle can carry four passengers without a traditional front or back.

pony_ai.name: Pony.ai
pony_ai.description: Pony.ai develops autonomous vehicle technology for robotaxis and trucking. Their AI-powered systems enable self-driving in complex urban environments across multiple cities.

comma_ai.name: Comma.ai
comma_ai.description: Comma.ai makes openpilot, an open-source driver assistance system. Their aftermarket device brings Tesla Autopilot-like features to compatible vehicles for a fraction of the cost.

ghost_autonomy.name: Ghost Autonomy
ghost_autonomy.description: Ghost Autonomy (now part of Applied Intuition) developed camera-first autonomous driving technology. Their approach enables highway autonomy with simpler sensor suites than competitors.

baidu_apollo.name: Baidu Apollo
baidu_apollo.description: Baidu's autonomous driving platform with robotaxi operations in China.

nvidia_drive.name: NVIDIA DRIVE
nvidia_drive.description: NVIDIA's end-to-end platform for autonomous vehicles.

nvidia_isaac.name: NVIDIA Isaac
nvidia_isaac.description: NVIDIA's platform for AI-powered robotic development and simulation.

nvidia_omniverse.name: NVIDIA Omniverse
nvidia_omniverse.description: NVIDIA's platform for 3D design, simulation, and digital twins.

softbank_robotics.name: SoftBank Robotics
softbank_robotics.description: Robotics company known for Pepper and NAO humanoid robots.

unitree.name: Unitree Robotics
unitree.description: Unitree Robotics creates affordable quadruped and humanoid robots. Their Go2 robot dog and H1 humanoid bring advanced robotics to research, entertainment, and industrial applications.

lockheed_martin.name: Lockheed Martin
lockheed_martin.description: Lockheed Martin integrates AI across defense systems for autonomous operations and decision support. Their AI technologies enhance fighter jets, satellites, and cybersecurity solutions.

northrop_grumman.name: Northrop Grumman
northrop_grumman.description: Northrop Grumman applies AI to autonomous systems, cyber defense, and space technology. Their AI solutions power unmanned aircraft, satellites, and advanced weapons systems.

l3harris.name: L3Harris Technologies
l3harris.description: L3Harris Technologies uses AI for defense communications, electronic warfare, and intelligence systems. Their solutions enable smarter surveillance, reconnaissance, and tactical networks.
l3harris.founders: 2019 merger of L3 Technologies and Harris Corporation

thales.name: Thales Group
thales.description: Thales Group deploys AI across defense, aerospace, and transportation. Their AI systems enhance air traffic control, cybersecurity, and autonomous military platforms.

rheinmetall.name: Rheinmetall
rheinmetall.description: Rheinmetall integrates AI into defense vehicles, weapons systems, and military technology. Their solutions enable autonomous reconnaissance, target acquisition, and battlefield awareness.

general_atomics.name: General Atomics
general_atomics.description: General Atomics develops AI-powered unmanned aircraft and defense systems. Their Predator and Reaper drones use AI for autonomous flight, surveillance, and mission execution.

aevex.name: AEVEX Aerospace
aevex.description: AEVEX Aerospace provides AI-powered ISR (intelligence, surveillance, reconnaissance) solutions. Their systems process aerial data in real-time to deliver actionable intelligence.

skydio.name: Skydio
skydio.description: Skydio builds autonomous drones that use AI to navigate and capture video without pilot input. Their drones self-fly around obstacles, enabling hands-free aerial inspection and photography.
skydio.founders: Adam Bry, Abraham Bachrach, Matt Donahoe

ibm_quantum.name: IBM Quantum
ibm_quantum.description: IBM's quantum computing division with cloud-accessible quantum computers.

ionq.name: IonQ
ionq.description: IonQ builds quantum computers using trapped ion technology, achieving industry-leading qubit quality. Their systems are available through major cloud providers for quantum computing research and applications.

rigetti.name: Rigetti Computing
rigetti.description: Rigetti Computing builds full-stack quantum computers and makes them accessible via the cloud. Their integrated approach includes chip fabrication, control systems, and software.

xanadu.name: Xanadu
xanadu.description: Xanadu develops photonic quantum computers using light-based qubits. Their approach enables room-temperature quantum computing with potential advantages for AI and optimization problems.

dwave.name: D-Wave
dwave.description: D-Wave builds quantum computers using quantum annealing technology. Their systems help enterprises solve complex optimization problems in logistics, finance, and machine learning.

amd.name: AMD
amd.description: AMD develops AI accelerators and GPUs that power machine learning workloads. Their MI300X chips compete with NVIDIA for AI training and inference, with strong CPU-GPU integration.

intel_habana.name: Intel Habana Labs
intel_habana.description: Intel's AI accelerator division with Gaudi chips for training/inference.

graphcore.name: Graphcore
graphcore.description: Graphcore designs Intelligence Processing Units (IPUs) optimized for machine learning workloads. Their architecture is purpose-built for AI's unique computational patterns, particularly for training complex models.
graphcore.funding: Acquired by SoftBank (2024), was at $2.8B valuation

qualcomm_ai.name: Qualcomm AI
qualcomm_ai.description: Qualcomm's AI solutions including Snapdragon with on-device AI.

stitch.name: Stitch
stitch.description: Cloud-first ETL service for data integration.

hevo.name: Hevo Data
hevo.description: Hevo provides no-code data pipelines that move data to warehouses in real-time. Their platform automates data integration for analytics and ML workflows.

matillion.name: Matillion
matillion.description: Matillion provides data transformation for cloud data platforms with AI-assisted pipeline building. Their platform helps enterprises prepare data for analytics and machine learning.

meltano.name: Meltano
meltano.description: Meltano is the open-source data integration platform for building ELT pipelines. It helps data teams move data to analytics platforms using Singer taps and dbt transformations.

looker.name: Looker
looker.description: Business intelligence platform acquired by Google.

mode.name: Mode Analytics
mode.description: Collaborative analytics platform for data teams.
mode.founders: Derek Steer, Benn Stancil, Josh Ferguson

deepnote.name: Deepnote
deepnote.description: Deepnote is the collaborative data science notebook built for teams. Their platform combines Jupyter compatibility with real-time collaboration, versioning, and integrations for modern data workflows.

observable.name: Observable
observable.description: Observable is the platform for exploratory data analysis and visualization. Their reactive notebooks enable data scientists and journalists to build interactive, shareable data explorations in JavaScript.

jupyter.name: Jupyter
jupyter.description: Jupyter provides open-source interactive notebooks for data science and machine learning. JupyterLab and Jupyter Notebook are industry standards for exploratory analysis and AI research.

teradata.name: Teradata
teradata.description: Teradata provides enterprise analytics and data warehousing at massive scale. Their AI/ML capabilities help enterprises derive insights from their largest datasets.

alloy.name: Alloy
alloy.description: Alloy provides identity verification and fraud prevention for banks and fintech. Their platform automates compliance decisions while reducing fraud and improving customer experience.
alloy.founders: Tommy Nicholas, Charles Hearn, Sara Du

socure.name: Socure
socure.description: Socure uses AI for identity verification and fraud prevention. Their platform helps financial institutions onboard customers quickly while catching fraudsters with industry-leading accuracy.

featurespace.name: Featurespace
featurespace.description: Featurespace pioneers adaptive behavioral analytics for fraud detection. Their ARIC platform uses machine learning to identify fraud in real-time, protecting billions of transactions globally.

nice_actimize.name: NICE Actimize
nice_actimize.description: Financial crime and compliance solutions with AI.

unit21.name: Unit21
unit21.description: Unit21 provides AI-powered fraud detection and compliance for fintech companies. Their no-code platform helps businesses catch fraud and meet anti-money laundering requirements.

black_diamond.name: Black Diamond Wealth Platform
black_diamond.description: Wealth management platform for financial advisors.

orion.name: Orion Advisor Solutions
orion.description: Orion provides AI-enhanced portfolio management and financial planning tools for advisors. Their platform helps wealth managers deliver personalized investment strategies at scale.

envestnet.name: Envestnet
envestnet.description: Envestnet provides wealth management technology and data intelligence to financial advisors. Their AI-powered platform helps advisors deliver better outcomes for millions of investors.

morningstar.name: Morningstar
morningstar.description: Morningstar provides investment research and data powered by AI analysis. Their platform helps investors make informed decisions with data-driven insights.

casetext.name: Casetext
casetext.description: Casetext, acquired by Thomson Reuters, created CoCounsel, the AI legal assistant. Their technology helps lawyers research cases, analyze documents, and prepare for litigation faster.
casetext.founders: Jake Heller, Pablo Arredondo, Laura Safdie

lexisnexis.name: LexisNexis
lexisnexis.description: Legal research and data analytics platform with AI capabilities.

westlaw.name: Westlaw
westlaw.description: Legal research platform with AI-powered search and analysis.

thomson_reuters.name: Thomson Reuters
thomson_reuters.description: Thomson Reuters integrates AI across legal research, news, and tax services. Their platforms use natural language processing to help professionals find answers and automate workflows.

relativity.name: Relativity
relativity.description: Relativity is the leading e-discovery platform for legal teams handling complex litigation. Their AI-powered tools help lawyers review documents, identify relevant evidence, and manage large cases.

luminance.name: Luminance

kira_systems.name: Kira Systems
kira_systems.description: Kira Systems (acquired by Litera) uses machine learning for contract analysis. Their technology extracts key provisions and data from contracts, accelerating due diligence and contract review.

replika.name: Replika
replika.description: Replika is an AI companion app that provides emotional support and conversation. Millions of users chat daily with their personalized AI friend, forming meaningful connections and improving mental wellness.

chai.name: Chai
chai.description: Chai is an AI chatbot platform where users create and chat with AI personalities. Their app hosts millions of conversations with user-generated characters and storytelling experiences.

nomi.name: Nomi
nomi.description: Nomi creates AI companions focused on emotional connection and personal growth. Their technology builds lasting relationships with users, providing support, conversation, and genuine companionship.

kindroid.name: Kindroid
kindroid.description: Kindroid provides customizable AI companions with personality and memory. Their platform creates unique AI friends that remember conversations and develop relationships over time.

hive.name: Hive AI
hive.description: Hive provides AI-powered content moderation and understanding. Their APIs enable platforms to automatically detect and filter harmful content at scale.

lucidworks.name: Lucidworks
lucidworks.description: Lucidworks provides AI-powered search and data discovery for enterprises. Their platform helps organizations find and understand information across all sources.

bing_copilot.name: Microsoft Bing Copilot
bing_copilot.description: Microsoft's AI-powered search assistant in Bing.

bolt.name: Bolt.new
bolt.description: Bolt.new is an AI-powered development environment that generates and runs full-stack applications entirely in the browser. Describe your app, and Bolt creates it with real-time preview and deployment.

bytedance_ai.name: ByteDance AI
bytedance_ai.description: ByteDance's AI research division behind Doubao LLM and AI-powered TikTok algorithms.

sensetime.name: SenseTime
sensetime.description: SenseTime is China's largest AI software company, specializing in computer vision. Their technology powers smart cities, autonomous driving, and enterprise applications across Asia.

megvii.name: Megvii (Face++)
megvii.description: Megvii (Face++) is the Chinese AI company behind the Face++ facial recognition platform. Their computer vision technology serves smart city, retail, and financial applications.

cloudwalk.name: CloudWalk Technology
cloudwalk.description: CloudWalk Technology provides AI solutions for smart cities and financial services in China. Their facial recognition and computer vision power identity verification and urban management.

yitu.name: Yitu Technology
yitu.description: Yitu Technology provides AI for healthcare, security, and smart city applications. Their computer vision and NLP capabilities serve enterprise and government customers in China.

zhipu_ai.name: Zhipu AI
zhipu_ai.description: Zhipu AI is one of China's leading AI companies, creators of the GLM (General Language Model) family. Founded by Tsinghua University researchers, they've built ChatGLM, one of China's most popular conversational AI systems with hundreds of millions of users.

baichuan.name: Baichuan Intelligence
baichuan.description: Baichuan Intelligence is a Beijing-based AI company building large language models optimized for Chinese language and culture. Founded by former Sogou CEO Wang Xiaochuan, their models excel at understanding Chinese context, idioms, and cultural nuances.

minimax.name: MiniMax
minimax.description: MiniMax is a Chinese AI startup building multimodal foundation models for both language and generation tasks. Their models power conversational AI, text-to-speech, and creative applications, making them a key player in China's AI ecosystem.

moonshot_ai.name: Moonshot AI (Kimi)
moonshot_ai.description: Moonshot AI, known for their Kimi assistant, is a Chinese AI company that broke through with ultra-long context windows. Their models can process millions of tokens, enabling analysis of entire books, codebases, and document collections in a single prompt.

01ai.name: 01.AI
01ai.description: 01.AI is a Chinese AI company founded by Kai-Fu Lee, the renowned AI investor and former head of Google China. Their Yi model family has achieved impressive benchmarks while remaining open-weight, advancing China's open-source AI capabilities.

stepfun.name: StepFun
stepfun.description: StepFun is a Chinese AI company developing multimodal large language models with strong reasoning capabilities. Their Step models combine language understanding with visual and analytical abilities for enterprise applications.

iflytek.name: iFlytek
iflytek.description: iFlytek is China's leading speech AI company with over two decades of research in voice recognition and synthesis. Their technologies power voice interfaces across education, healthcare, and consumer devices, serving over a billion users annually.

4paradigm.name: 4Paradigm
4paradigm.description: 4Paradigm provides enterprise AI platforms that enable businesses to build and deploy ML models. Their technology serves China's largest banks, telcos, and manufacturers.

horizon_robotics.name: Horizon Robotics
horizon_robotics.description: Horizon Robotics develops AI chips and solutions for intelligent vehicles and AIoT. Their Journey processors power ADAS and autonomous driving in major Chinese automakers.

cambricon.name: Cambricon Technologies
cambricon.description: Cambricon Technologies designs AI processors for cloud and edge computing. Their chips power AI inference in data centers, smartphones, and intelligent systems across China.

biren.name: Biren Technology
biren.description: Biren Technology designs high-performance AI chips for data centers. Their BR100 GPU competes with NVIDIA in China's growing AI chip market, addressing the demand for domestic AI accelerators.

enflame.name: Enflame Technology
enflame.description: Enflame Technology develops AI training and inference chips for cloud and edge. Their CloudBlazer and TorchSpark accelerators serve China's growing demand for AI computing infrastructure.

dji.name: DJI
dji.description: DJI is the world's leading drone manufacturer, integrating AI for autonomous flight and computer vision. Their consumer and enterprise drones use AI for obstacle avoidance, tracking, and aerial intelligence.

weride.name: WeRide
weride.description: WeRide develops autonomous driving technology for robotaxis and commercial vehicles. Their Level 4 self-driving systems operate in multiple cities across China and the Middle East.

tusimple.name: TuSimple
tusimple.description: TuSimple builds autonomous trucking technology for freight transportation. Their AI systems enable semi-trucks to drive long-haul routes with minimal human intervention.
